definition: pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
to take down (in writing)/notes/a type of literature consisting mainly of short sketches/CL:本[ben3]
to put down in writing/to take down notes/transcript/record
the wording and purport of what one writes
foreshadowing (literary device)/foretaste of material to come (in essay or story)
perfectly straight/straight as a ramrod/bolt upright

sentences.english: Can you use lipstick on your eyes?
sentences.chinese: 把唇线笔当作眼线笔使用或者反一反？

sentences.english: Exam, only write the pen of the broken broken voice and more or less beating.
sentences.chinese: 考试中，只有写字笔的碎碎声音和或多或少的心跳声。

sentences.english: Nothing was heard in the room but the hurrying pen of the stripling.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里悄然无声，只有年轻人的笔匆忙划过纸页。
汤姆把他的笔借给了我。

sentences.english: Occurs on a pen thread when the cursor leaves the bounds of an element.
sentences.chinese: 当用户将触笔从数字化仪上提起时，在笔线程上发生。

sentences.english: Holidays indicated by the detector shall be marked with chalk or felt-tip marker to identify the area to be repaired.
sentences.chinese: 漏涂仪显示的漏涂区域用粉笔或毡制粗头笔标识。

sentences.english: He refused to accept the money.
Jason prepares all his accounts using a microcomputer but I do mine with common or garden pencil and paper.
sentences.chinese: 贾森用微型计算机做帐，但我只用普通的纸和笔做帐。

sentences.english: It's a benefical deal for the company to buy this new production line.
sentences.chinese: 购买这条新的生产线对这个公司来说是笔有利的交易。

sentences.english: Someone practiced Indian marks with this pen and ink.
sentences.chinese: 有人用这只笔和墨水练过画印第安印记。

sentences.english: I’m still fond of the trusty pen and paper.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然喜欢可靠的纸和笔。

sentences.english: Procrastination is spending 30 mins looking for the right pen.
sentences.chinese: 拖延症是花30分钟去找一支对的笔。

sentences.english: The man abstracted a pen from my pocket.
sentences.chinese: 那人从我口袋里偷去了一支笔。

sentences.english: Don’t torment yourself if a trade continues winning without you.
sentences.chinese: 不要折磨你自己即使你出来之后那笔交易还在赢钱。

sentences.english: Is this your book? I found it under the desk.
sentences.chinese: 这是你的笔吗？我在桌下捡到的。

definition: paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
ability to write/writing skill/written/in written form
nib/pen point/the tip of a writing brush or pencil
to do a sum in writing/written calculation
book/notebook/Japanese-style self-published comic (esp. an erotic one), aka "dōjinshi"/CL:本[ben3]/edition
